name: Grange Holborn Hotel

reviews.text: Spent a weekend at Holborn. Rooms were large and clean. Bathtub was narrow and certainly not "stunning" :(. Hotel is clean, staff are friendly. Breakfast excellent. All that being said - this is still not 5star rating. Location was good as well.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: Quiet, very quiet. Good insulation in the rooms. We had a quiet room on the first floor, room 101!
reviews.title: Weekend break, central location

reviews.text: The hotel lobby looked a little dated, and it didn't have the feel of a 5 star. I wouldn't say it was luxury.
reviews.title: Very ordinary

reviews.text: But the rooms were large and clean. Comfortable bed and friendly staff. Great location within walking distance of theatre land and many bars and restaurants near covent garden.
reviews.title: Not worth 5 star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And for a VERY reasonable price, dare I say cheap. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Overall not worth the money

reviews.text: Booked 4 rooms as part of a family wedding in London in January. Got a very reasonable advanced rate non refundable direct on their website. Asked for 3 rooms to be together and one separate and when we arrived they were as we requested. 3 rooms on the 3rd floor and one room on the 9th. Rooms were clean, comfortable and a good size. Only one minor problem - our room was not cleaned on the 1st day - no idea why. Did not happen again. Lovely pool and gym area - good size for its location. Staff friendly and efficient. Hot breakfast very well stocked and good quality. Good location. Would recommend and definetly stay again.
reviews.title: Comfortable andd pleasant

reviews.text: I got a room for £85 using a mixture of cashback and lastminute.com. I would say that was a fair price for this hotel. However, i look at the advertised rates and would urge people to shop around for the best deals.
reviews.title: Worth it at a discount

reviews.text: The pool, sauna, steam room and gym are all fine. The room was clean but could do with an additional power socket. I did feel i was in a four rather than five star though.
reviews.title: comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were ok but generally quite scruffy. There was no information about breakfast in the room, except the room service menu, which would charge £20 for breakfast plus £4 for a tray charge. It simply could not be worth it. Also, an omlette for breakfast would have incurred the same charge, which leaves a negative impression.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.text: We went to London for the weekend to go to the theatre and see some exhibitions so we wanted somewhere convenient and not too expensive. The Grange fitted the bill. It was close to the tube which meant we could reach the museums easily and it was within walking distance of all the theatres and Covent Garden. The staff were friendly and the rooms clean,spacious and comfortable with everything you would expect in the room.We were not on the main road and on theninth floor so had a good nights sleep.The lounge was pleasent to sit in with friendly service and excellent hot chocolate. There is a wide room service and 24 hour menu. At breakfast there was a wide range of foods and the hot breakfast was delicious and we didnot have to queue.We would certainly stay there on our next visit.
reviews.title: A good stay in central London

reviews.text: Whilst the position of the hotel was ideal for our needs, the hotel was a bit jaded. Not helped by one of the lifts not working resulting in a long wait for a lift to ascend or descend. Some people might be bothered that we could hear the Tube on the seventh floor (not prominently I hasten to add). Swimming pool good. Breakfast on Saturday and Sunday was second-rate compared to Monday's - the latter had freshly squeezed juice and fresh fruit salad - compared to what tasted like carton juice and definitely was tinned fruit at the weekend. Breakfast was included - otherwise continental costs £25 and full English (from a self-service buffet) £33 per person. However, room was a good size and comfortable; service was good and welcome was professional. We'd stay again. We booked directly from the hotel.
reviews.title: Not 5 star - and breakfast lottery

reviews.text: I try to stay at this hotel now when I'm in London as the location really is excellent. It's not a 5* but it's clean, tidy and has everything I need. It's within walking distance to the West End, Covent Garden etc and is a stone's throw away from the tube to go further afield. Can't fault the hotel or the staff at all
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and even better location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Average five star hotel in an area of London which is a little different to where I usually stay (Mayfair). The area is actually not bad and in walking distance of Covent Garden, West End, Soho etc. The hotel is ok. Nothing special but did feel confortable. The room was slightly larger then average and clean. No reason why I would not recommend this place. Value wise? Pay about £150/170. The fitness centre and pool are actually very good although the latter could do with being a little deeper. Took full advantage of the facilities on offer.
reviews.title: Why not.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend break on a room only basis as we were out & about a lot, so didn't eat at the hotel at all & therefore cannot comment on the food. The room was quite small as is expected in London, but perfectly clean & nice & we had all that we needed. The staff were friendly & helpful & it's an ideal location for the British Museum & theatreland.
reviews.title: More 4 star than 5, but clean, helpful staff & good stay

reviews.text: The hotel was amazing we had a great stay check in was easy and had a beautiful room on the 8th floor with a lovely view. The hotel was extremely clean and the Japanese restaurant located in the hotel was very good, it is lovely to be able to enjoy the swimming pool, gym and steamroom and sauna which are all included in the price such a delight in the centre on London a walk away from leichester square at a great price.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in great location I loved my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband books this hotel as a "top secret" hotel from lastminute.com as a surprise for my birthday. I expected the lobby to be bigger however the staff were really nice and no problems with check-in/out. We were early and our room wasnt quite ready so while we went for lunch. On our return our luggage had been sent to our rooms. The bedroom was clean and as peffect for the night and however as we had a street veiw it was very noisey in the evening. We had drinks at the bar in the evening which were really nice and the staff were really good. We didnt have breakfast as we read the comments and as it was sunday nothing around was open. However on our walk to Picadilliy Circus we found a really nice place which did a full vegetarian english for less than a fiver.
reviews.title: greast hotel for the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall for the price and location this was great.
reviews.title: No faults whatsoever!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend, we walked to the hotel from Kings Cross which took no more than 20 minutes. We are familiar with London so would rather walk that use the tube. Upon arrival at the hotel, the staff were extremley friendly, nothing was too much. Our room was on the 8th floor and it was huge! Ok the hotel is not of a modern style but it is clean and tidy. Breakfast was great, enought choice, anyone that finds fault is just being too picky. I have stayed at the Clareneden which is also part of the Grange chain and my room there was tiny! We used the leisure facilities which were great. The hotel is in a fantastic location for the West End, there is no need to rely on the tubes if this is the area you are wanting to explore, everything is in walking distance. I have come back from my visit and reccommended the hotel to so many of my friends. Initially before we booked we couldn't decide between Holborn or St Pauls - Holborn all the way for location, we went down to St Pauls and yes it looks like a 5* hotel but Holborn gave us everything that we needed. Ive already started saving for my next visit and I hope that we will be just as lucky! Thank you Holborn for a lovely weekend!
reviews.title: Stay Here!!

reviews.text: In the interest of full disclosure I wrote a very negative review a few months back. The manager of the hotel sent me an e mail and asked that I give it another chance. Wow! what a difference. Gone was the surly staff replaced by friendly and welcome greeting at reception. The large rooms were now expertly cleaned by a much more attentive staff and no strange alarms going of in the middle of the night. Noticeable improvement in the very comfortable lobby lounge area where servers actually seemed to notice you and provide very attentive service. It was like the entire hotel had had a giant attitude adjustment! When you combine this with really large rooms and well stocked bathrooms and a great location withing walking distance to covent garden and the west end and very reasonable rates this place is a winner!! I can tell you with this transformation I will be staying here from now on!! Only one small criticism..PLUGS! There arent enough empty wall plugs for todays techno world. I would suggest putting additional extension sockets in each room on the desk.
reviews.title: A good return !

reviews.text: This time, we were 6 families to have a holiday in London !
reviews.title: Good but room for improvment

description: The elegantly composed Grange Holborn Hotel is uniquely placed to satisfy the most discerning visitors to the capital; whether enjoying the local theatres, shops, museums, galleries and parks or maximizing time in the financial heart of the City, the Grange Holborn Hotel, provides the perfect location for any visit to the Capital.
